channel.title: The Great RSPS - Please Read!
channel.description:
Hey guys, sorry for the inactivity. I have this brilliant (maybe) suggestion. We make RS EXACTLY like a specific time (Pre-EOC/2007/Anything else)
[size=14pt][b]How?[/b][/size]
I dont know how to exactly explain it, but we start off with the best framework there is at the moment (apollo probably). Then, we host this web-server of some sort where EVERYONE who is illegible can make a contribution.
[size=14pt][b]What if someone tries to erase our work?[/b][/size]
We can get some sort of rollback feature, and everytime someone opens the files, it saves itself before someone types. Therefore, if someone for example named Tr0ll3r9000 decides to erase everything, we rollback to a specific time and there we go!
[size=14pt][b]What if the code is all wrong and/or non-efficient?[/b][/size]
I have the suggestion that it could go to trusted people to examine the code before it is implemented in and saved (ex:arham 4)
[size=14pt][b]Why should we do this?[/b][/size]
This will be very rewarding in ways like GAINING players to the rsps community, instead of rapidly losing right now. This would also be a fun activity, as some of us also can improve our programming skills from this.
So, what do you guys think?

item.title: The Great RSPS - Please Read!
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“lare69, post:7, topic:547586”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=666494.msg4456052#msg4456052 date=1414967525]
Or people could just help David make the server he has been working on for over a year for Mopar.
[/quote][/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: The Great RSPS - Please Read!
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

thank you for your great suggestion. I would love to help you out with this. we can both be project leaders? I have loads of great ideas and experience with these rollback features and web server type data controls. I think you would be good to work with and I know the team will need me.

thank you

Read full topic

item.title: The Great RSPS - Please Read!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:8, topic:547586”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=666494.msg4456047#msg4456047 date=1414965685]

We can get some sort of rollback feature, and everytime someone opens the files, it saves itself before someone types. Therefore, if someone for example named Tr0ll3r9000 decides to erase everything, we rollback to a specific time and there we go!

This already exists as version control: git, svn, or even fudgeing cvs.

Hell even dropbox does a bit of version control. Not like git or anything, but I’ve recovered files I’ve deleted before.
[/quote]
Now that’s some bullshit. I emailed dropbox to get some files back and they replied saying some shit like “sorry, we aren’t retroactive”… Those bitches[/quote]
This is what I’m talking about:

Read full topic

Hell even dropbox does a bit of version control. Not like git or anything, but I’ve recovered files I’ve deleted before.[/quote]
Now that’s some bullshit. I emailed dropbox to get some files back and they replied saying some shit like “sorry, we aren’t retroactive”… Those bitches

item.title: The Great RSPS - Please Read!
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

AliAbid:

I dont know how to exactly explain it, but we start off with the best framework there is at the moment (apollo probably). Then, we host this web-server of some sort where EVERYONE who is illegible can make a contribution.

All public frameworks leave a lot to be desired.

AliAbid:

We can get some sort of rollback feature, and everytime someone opens the files, it saves itself before someone types. Therefore, if someone for example named Tr0ll3r9000 decides to erase everything, we rollback to a specific time and there we go!

This already exists as version control: git, svn, or even fudgeing cvs.

AliAbid:

I have the suggestion that it could go to trusted people to examine the code before it is implemented in and saved (ex:arham 4)

The only people here qualified to make those decisions probably have no interest.

Oh, and this has been suggested more times than I can recall. It always fails.

Read full topic
